title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), being of the opinion that
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Services (Prescription
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Health Services (Prescription 

Charges) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited health service (prescription charges) regulation 2020

title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), being of the opinion that
heading: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 November 2020.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations shall come into operation on 1 November 2020.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), being of the opinion that
heading: 3. The amount referred to in section 59(1A) of the Health Act 1970 (No.1
text_raw:
3. The amount referred to in section 59(1A) of the Health Act 1970 (No.1 

of 1970) is varied to €1.50.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), being of the opinion that
heading: 4. The amount referred to in section 59(1B)(a) of the Health Act 1970 is
text_raw:
4. The amount referred to in section 59(1B)(a) of the Health Act 1970 is 

varied to €15.00.

title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), being of the opinion that
heading: 5. The Health Services (Prescription Charges) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
5. The Health Services (Prescription Charges) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 

553 of 2017) are revoked. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th October, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

[464] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

20 October, 2020. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 
Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

27 October, 2020. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [464]

title: Title of Minister) Order 2011 (S.I. No. 219 of 2011)), being of the opinion that
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for a reduction in the prescription charge from €2.00 
to €1.50 per item, and for a reduction in the monthly cap from €20.00 to €15.00, 
per person or family. 

These Regulations revoke 
Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 553 of 2017). 

the Health Services (Prescription Charges) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [464] 5
